keyword: how many calories in a jelly sandwich
title: How Many Calories in a Jelly Sandwich?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a jelly sandwich (PB&J style), including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Jelly Sandwich?
assumptions: Standard PB&J: 2 slices white bread, 2 tbsp peanut butter, 1 tbsp grape jelly; no added butter or extras.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by bread type, PB brand, jelly amount, and preparation; check labels for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: A typical jelly sandwich (PB&J) contains about 402 kcal with 13 g protein and 50 g carbs.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged products.

tweaks.label: Use whole wheat bread instead of white
Reduce to 1 tbsp peanut butter (half the amount)

faqs.q: How many calories in a jelly sandwich without peanut butter?
faqs.a: About 200-250 kcal for just bread and jelly, depending on portions.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a standard jelly sandwich?
faqs.a: Around 13 g, mostly from the peanut butter.

faqs.q: Are jelly sandwiches high in sugar?
faqs.a: Yes, about 21 g total sugars per sandwich from jelly and bread.

faqs.q: How does bread type affect calories in a jelly sandwich?
faqs.a: White bread adds more carbs/calories than whole grain; switch for ~20 kcal savings.

faqs.q: What if I use low-sugar jelly?
faqs.a: Reduces sugars by 10-15 g and calories by ~40 kcal per sandwich.
